captions.text:
Welcome to howtocookthat.net. Today we are
looking at how to make homemade rolled fondant.

To start with in a bowl, place 1/2 cup of
glucose syrup or you can use corn syrup, 1

tablespoon of glycerin; that just makes it
a bit smoother, then sprinkle over the top

of that 1 tablespoon of gelatin and then pour
a tablespoon of water over the top. Leave

it for a moment for the gelatin to soften
and then just pop it in the microwave for
30 seconds, stir and then 30 seconds, stir.

Check that the gelatin is completely dissolved
just by picking some up on a spoon and having

a quick look. And then what you want to do
is pour it into a bowl in which we have got

900 grams of pure icing sugar, you can't use
the mixture because it has cornstarch in it.

You need to sieve it to make sure there is
no lumps in it at all otherwise you are going

to have lumps in your fondant, then simply
turn it on low and allow it to mix.

Now, if you don't have an electric mixer you
can make it at home but it is going to be

a lot of work, a lot of hand-kneading. At
this point, if you need to, add one extra

teaspoon of water. Take it out of the bowl
and knead it until you get a nice smooth ball

of fondant. That is quite firm if you want
it to be stickier or wetter just add more

water, but for me that is about the texture
I like to start with because by the time you

add your colors, which are also moist, you
can make it too sticky if it is too sticky

title: how to make homemade fondant sugar paste icing how to cook that ann reardon
